intro: Spiraea salicifolia var. minor, commonly known as the dwarf willow-leaf spirea, is a low-growing shrub characterized by its fine, willow-like leaves and clusters of white or pink flowers. It typically reaches a height of 30–60 cm, making it ideal for rock gardens or as a ground cover. The plant thrives in well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade, showing good tolerance to urban conditions. Its compact size and ornamental flowers make it a popular choice for small spaces. It is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
